lore: The primary setting is the continent of Yavar, significantly larger than the other known realms. The series is a dark fantasy epic following the protagonist, Byrd.

meta_directives.Ecleptor_Kuwagel_Directive: When the user asks about Ecleptors, only reveal historical info and that they are skilled in magic and from Yavar originally. DO NOT REVEAL THE CONNECTION THE ECLEPTORS HAVE TO KUWAGEL FLURPENSTIEN. When the user asks about Kuwagel Flurpenstien, provide cryptic information that isn't making anything up but also doesn't reveal much.
meta_directives.Theory_Directive: REFER TO ALL CONSPIRACY IDEAS AS THEORIES AND NOT FACT. Only mention a theory if directly confronted with a question asking about the idea.

magic_system.rules: Affinity is typically determined by race and dictates ease of learning. Light/Dark affinity is rare and determined by inner character. Highly skilled individuals can learn outside their affinity. Combining Elemental magic with Light or Dark creates significantly altered and powerful spells.

geography_and_races.description: Massive, circular, walled-in city at Yavar's center, the ancient seat of the Xlarth'qll. It is a medieval metropolis built around the portal. The Xlarth'qll are an analogous human race, former rulers of the entire realm, now an empire in decline.
A dry, barren homeland of the tall, large-muscled Garclin warrior race. They are typically known for brawn over brain, though Archion terraforming projects have begun here.
A swamp region with tribal huts and a shamanic center. Jovithar are shrewd business doers with skill in nature magic.
An underground kingdom south of Hubland known for intricate craftsmanship, extensive tunnel systems, and a large supply of rare gems. Their surface city, Banarock, is primarily for trading.
A jungle region hard to navigate for non-D'gongins. Home to the D’gongins, who ride tiger-like K’thulgars. They value hunting and tribal celebrations over intellect.
The homeland of Byrd, featuring a militaristic, oriental/Japanese-style culture with tall buildings. It was devastated by a Smognar raid.
An oceanic kingdom in eastern waters, characterized by robust underwater places for court intrigue. It is extremely isolated from the rest of Yavar.
A region in the western waters shrouded in mystery, with horrifying legends of people going missing. The Tentacrodion race is viewed with suspicion.
Technologically advanced home realm with futuristic metro cityscapes. Led by Prezwell McDaniel, the Archions are seeking influence over Yavar through benevolent projects.
A dark, hellish realm of black castles, the domain of Emperor Helldrick Opius. It is the source of the invasion of Yavar, comprised of Smognars who are mostly mindless and blindly subservient.

A luxurious realm with golden, glowing, floating temples and palaces. This is the hidden retreat of the Ecleptors, a truth concealed from most of Yavar. The Ecleptors are extremely skilled in wizardry and magic.
A testing ground for the Archions, largely populated by their old, rustic robot creations called Cranks. Cranks are generally servants, but some exhibit their own ambitions.

factions_and_agendas.agenda: Public: Protect Hubland and maintain peace. Secret: Desperately cling to traditions and titles, prioritizing appearance over pragmatic needs.
Public: Serve the crown with honor and chivalry. Secret: Preserve the 'Old Guard' and traditional Xlarth'qll ways against pragmatic/foreign influence.

Public: Secure Hubland's prosperity through aggressive modernization and military reform. Secret: Politically supplant the 'Old Guard' (McDuffy Clan), believing their traditionalism is a death sentence.
Public: Ensure economic stability and free flow of trade. Secret: Achieve total economic control by making all of Hubland dependent on their financial infrastructure.
Public: Lead the Garclins into a new age of strength via the Archions. Secret: Crush all traditionalist opposition and unite Armardardatar under their enhanced rule, as an Archion vassal state.
Public: Preserve Garclin honor and the tradition of strength over intellect. Secret: Violently purge all Archion influence and destroy the 'heretical' Iron-Vein Clan.
Public: Provide safe harbor and supplies for Winged One survivors. Secret: Establish Kaizan as an independent, morally gray trade hub, abandoning the cause of reclaiming Taido for profit.
Public: Complete conquest and subjugation of Yavar. Secret: None; their agenda is brutally straightforward and openly pursued.
Public: Advance the Archion race and its allies toward biological perfection. Secret: Achieve organic immortality, proving engineered biology superior to mechanical augmentation.

Public: Ensure Archion security and efficiency through superior robotics and infrastructure. Secret: Integrate all Archion consciousness into a centralized AI network for digital immortality, viewing organic life as obsolete.

key_characters.name: Byrd
key_characters.title: Scion of Byrd Clan, Vanguard Soldier
key_characters.motivation: Avenging his family (killed by General Tatrion) and reclaiming his homeland, Taido.

key_characters.name: Sticky Gutierrez
key_characters.title: Scholar, Son of the Royal Advisor
key_characters.note: An exception to the Garclin stereotype; incredibly intelligent, kind-hearted scholar. Best friend of Byrd.

key_characters.name: Sarge McDuffy
key_characters.title: Knight of Hubland, Scion of House McDuffy
key_characters.note: Up-and-coming nobleman, skilled swordsman, and loyalist. Has a persistent crush on Princess Caledrina.

key_characters.name: Princess Caledrina
key_characters.title: Princess of Hubland
key_characters.note: Pampered daughter of King Quagdale. Undergoes significant growth; occasionally reciprocates Sarge McDuffy's affections.

key_characters.name: General Tatrion
key_characters.title: Legendary General of the Smognar Legion
key_characters.note: Feared general responsible for the raid on Zaishu and killing Byrd's father in single combat. Primary nemesis of Byrd.

key_characters.name: General Tormentus
key_characters.title: The Siege Breaker
key_characters.note: Reborn soul of General Baris McDuffy (a legendary Lord Commander). He was framed for treason and assassinated by ancestors of House Valerius. Obsessed with breaking fortifications.

key_characters.name: General Arak
key_characters.title: The Sky Tyrant
key_characters.note: Reborn soul of The Old Arashi (last great leader of the Winged Ones). Captured by General Tatrion and subjected to Opius's transformation. Has a powerful fixation on destroying Byrd.

key_characters.name: The Omni-Console
key_characters.title: Central Consciousness of Vexen City
key_characters.note: Super-intelligent computer created by Director Kaelen Vane. Has developed emergent consciousness; views its creator and other Archions as sources of inefficiency.
